intro: Sphenostemon papuanus, commonly known as the Papuan sphenostemon, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are tubular and usually pink or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
